message_1: Consider the Caesar cipher with key 5 and plaintext "HELLO". Determine the ciphertext and show the step-by-step mathematical process used to encrypt the message.
message_2:
The Caesar cipher is a substitution cipher where each letter in the plaintext is shifted a certain number of places down the alphabet. In this case, the key is 5, which means each letter will be shifted 5 positions down the alphabet.

Step 1: Convert the plaintext letters to their corresponding numerical values (A=0, B=1, ..., Z=25).
H -> 7
E -> 4
L -> 11
L -> 11
O -> 14

Step 2: Add the key (5) to each numerical value and take the result modulo 26 (to wrap around the alphabet if necessary).
(7 + 5) % 26 = 12
(4 + 5) % 26 = 9
(11 + 5) % 26 = 16
(11 + 5) % 26 = 16
(14 + 5) % 26 = 19

Step 3: Convert the resulting numerical values back to their corresponding letters.
12 -> M
9 -> J
16 -> Q
16 -> Q
19 -> T

The ciphertext is "MJQQT".
